overview.description: Tornado Cash is an open source, non-custodial, fully decentralized cryptocurrency mixer (tumbler) that runs on Ethereum Virtual Machine-compatible networks. It is a fully decentralized protocol for private transactions on Ethereum, BSC (BNB Chain), Optimism, Polygon, Avalanche, Arbitrum, and Gnosis networks.
overview.status: Active (smart contracts remain on blockchain), Founders under legal proceedings

technology.description: Tornado Cash uses cryptographic techniques to break the on-chain link between source and destination addresses, providing transaction privacy for cryptocurrency users.

deposit_process.step_1: User generates random bytes which serve as commitment
deposit_process.step_2: Commitment is computed through Pedersen Hash (zk-SNARK friendly)
deposit_process.step_3: Token and 20 MiMC hash sent to smart contract
deposit_process.step_4: Contract inserts commitment into Merkle tree
deposit_process.privacy_mechanism: No link between depositor and commitment stored on-chain

merkle_tree.structure: Fixed depth tree where leaves start as zero values
merkle_tree.function: Non-zero values added by replacing zero leaves from left to right
merkle_tree.purpose: Stores all deposit commitments without revealing relationships

withdrawal_process.step_1: Random bytes split into two parts: secret and nullifier
withdrawal_process.step_2: Nullifier is hashed and sent on-chain for verification
withdrawal_process.step_3: User creates zk-SNARK proof of knowing Merkle path to commitment leaf
withdrawal_process.step_4: Proof includes preimage (secret, nullifier) without revealing it
withdrawal_process.step_5: Contract verifies proof and checks nullifier hasn't been used
withdrawal_process.step_6: If valid, funds released to new address

zk_snarks.full_name: Zero-Knowledge Succinct Non-interactive Argument of Knowledge

properties.zero_knowledge: Verifier learns nothing except statement is true
properties.succinct: Proof size and verifier time is sublinear
properties.non_interactive: No interaction needed between prover and verifier

zk_snarks.privacy_guarantee: Even though nullifier is public, no way to link it to original commitment

anti_double_spending.check: Contract ensures nullifierHash is unused before processing withdrawal
anti_double_spending.result: Each deposit can only be withdrawn once

key_features: Multiple denomination pools for different amounts

roman_storm.name: Roman Storm

charges: Conspiracy to operate an unlicensed money transmitting business

guilty: Conspiracy to operate an unlicensed money transmitting business
verdict.note: Jury unable to reach unanimous verdict on 2 of 3 charges after 4 days of deliberations

legal_status.potential_sentence: Up to 45 years maximum (combined), convicted charge carries up to 5 years
legal_status.current_status: Free on bail, sentencing date not yet set
legal_status.bail_status: Not a flight risk due to U.S. ties and bond size

roman_storm.bio: One of the three co-founders of Tornado Cash. Arrested in Washington state in 2023. Declined to testify at his trial. The case centers on allegations that Tornado Cash helped launder over $1 billion in criminal proceeds.

roman_semenov.name: Roman Semenov

charges: Conspiracy to operate an unlicensed money transmitting business
legal_status.current_status: Sanctioned by OFAC, indicted by DOJ, remains at large
legal_status.note: U.S. Treasury designated and sanctioned as co-founder of sanctioned virtual currency mixer

roman_semenov.bio: Co-founder of Tornado Cash, Russian citizen who remains at large. Sanctioned by U.S. Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control in August 2023, same day Roman Storm was arrested.

alexey_pertsev.name: Alexey Pertsev
alexey_pertsev.nationality: Russian citizen (31 years old as of May 2024)

legal_status.sentence: 64 months (5 years and 4 months) in prison
legal_status.court_reasoning: Judge Henrieke Slaar stated: 'Tornado Cash in its nature and functioning is a tool intended for criminals.' Court found Pertsev 'made a habit of committing money laundering' and should have been more suspicious about possible criminal origins of transactions.
legal_status.appeal_status: Filed appeal with s-Hertogenbosch court of appeal
legal_status.immediate_consequence: Escorted by police to cells under court, then transferred to appropriate Dutch prison

alexey_pertsev.bio: Russian developer and co-founder of Tornado Cash. First of the three founders to be arrested. Detained in Netherlands since August 2022. Found guilty by Dutch court in May 2024.

initial_sanctions.authority: U.S. Department of Treasury, Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC)
initial_sanctions.reason: Tornado Cash laundered more than $7 billion worth of virtual currency since creation in 2019, including over $455 million stolen by Lazarus Group (North Korea state-sponsored hackers)
immediate_consequences: Made illegal for U.S. citizens, residents, and companies to use service

court_challenge.outcome: Appellate court found OFAC overstepped authority
court_challenge.reasoning: Immutable smart contracts comprising Tornado Cash could not be classified as 'property' under IEEPA because they lacked hallmarks of ownership, control, and exclusivity
court_challenge.significance: First major legal challenge to OFAC's authority over decentralized protocols

sanctions_lifted.treasury_statement: Exercised discretion to remove economic sanctions based on Administration's review of novel legal and policy issues raised by use of financial sanctions against financial and commercial activity occurring within evolving technology and legal environments
sanctions_lifted.note: Treasury remains deeply concerned about North Korea's state-sponsored hacking and money laundering campaign
sanctions_lifted.impact: Sanctions lifted, but criminal charges against developers remain pending

lazarus_group_activity.source: March 2022 attack on Axie Infinity's Ronin network bridge
lazarus_group_activity.significance: Major factor in OFAC sanctions and criminal charges

criminal_allegations.prosecution_theory: Defendants created, operated, and promoted Tornado Cash knowing it would facilitate money laundering for cybercriminals and sanctioned entities
criminal_allegations.defense_theory: Developers wrote open-source code that enables private crypto transactions in non-custodial manner; prosecution threatens right to code and targets code itself rather than illegal use

key_concerns: Code itself being targeted rather than malicious use
Privacy as a fundamental right in cryptocurrency
notable_reactions: Crypto community voiced outrage at Tornado Cash developer verdicts
Concerns about chilling effect on privacy technology development
Debates about responsibility of tool creators vs. tool users
Questions about legitimacy of privacy in cryptocurrency ecosystem

key_questions: Can immutable smart contracts be classified as 'property'?
Are developers liable for how users employ their open-source code?
What is the scope of OFAC's authority over decentralized protocols?
How should privacy tools be regulated in cryptocurrency?
implications: Shapes future of privacy technology development

timeline.2019: Tornado Cash founded by Roman Storm, Roman Semenov, and Alexey Pertsev
timeline.2019-2022: Protocol facilitates over $7 billion in cryptocurrency mixing
timeline.march_2022: Lazarus Group uses Tornado Cash to launder $455M from Ronin bridge hack
timeline.august_2022: OFAC sanctions Tornado Cash; Alexey Pertsev arrested in Netherlands
timeline.august_2023: Roman Storm arrested; Roman Semenov sanctioned by OFAC
timeline.november_2024: Appellate court rules OFAC overstepped authority on smart contract sanctions
timeline.may_2024: Alexey Pertsev found guilty, sentenced to 64 months in Dutch prison
timeline.march_2025: OFAC lifts sanctions on Tornado Cash
timeline.july_2025: Roman Storm trial begins in New York
timeline.august_2025: Storm found guilty of unlicensed money transmission; jury deadlocked on other charges
